page.title: 17SOCIAL LIFE IN CROUGHTON 1
page.content: Croughton is a pleasant village in which to live, although it is not as decorative as many in the area. Most people are outgoing and friendly, and newcomers usually find themselves made welcome very quickly. There is no apparent social hierarchy in the village now, and a fairly egalitarian approach prevails. Social activities revolve around the Blackbird Public House and the Village Club. The publican has a 'Cosy Hour' on Mondays for the OAP's to meet and chat, and there are teams for Darts, Pool, Dominoes and Aunt Sally. There is usually Live Entertainment on Fridays. The Club is located in the old Reading Room, and is run by a committee. Whist drives and other events are held regularly, as are discos and events for the younger members.
